intro: Limonium medium, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the Plumbagaceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage, which are adapted to coastal environments. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy species often found in maritime climates. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, adding vibrant color to coastal landscapes. Limonium medium is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate salt spray and wind.
